:1:

IN IN IN THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY

IN IN IN INSOLVENCY INSOLVENCY INSOLVENCY

REPORT REPORT REPORT NO. 166 OF 2006 NO. 166 OF 2006 NO. 166 OF 2006

IN IN IN

INSOLVENCY INSOLVENCY INSOLVENCY NO. 160 OF 1968 NO. 160 OF 1968 NO. 160 OF 1968

Re.: 1. M/s. Pawar & Bros.

. B.Y. Pawar (Personal),

. V.P. Pawar (Personal),

. T.P. Pawar (Personal).

... Insolvents.

Ex-parte :

R.C. Rangrej.

... Petitioning Creditors.

.....

Mr. G.G. Ketkar, 1st Asstt. to Official Assignee.

.....

CORAM CORAM CORAM : DR. D.Y. CHANDRACHUD,J. : DR. D.Y. CHANDRACHUD,J. : DR. D.Y. CHANDRACHUD,J.

ND ND ND DECEMBER, 2006. DECEMBER, 2006. DECEMBER, 2006.

P.C. P.C. P.C. : : :

.

An order of adjudication was passed on 7th January

.

From time to time, a dividend has been declared by

the Official Assignee as set out in the report.

The total

amount

lying

in

the hands of the Official

Assignee

is

Rs.50,866.62 ps. The prayer of the Official Assignee is

to the following effect :-

(a)

The Official Assignee may be permitted

to

club the estate account in the name

of

[1] B.Y.

Pawar (Personal), [2] V.P.

Pawar

(personal),

[3] T.P.

Pawar (personal) and

[4]

M/s.

Pawar Brothers & Ors.

in

order

to

declare and distribute dividend to

the

preferential

creditors of the M/s.

Pawar

Brothers & Ors. on their proved

preferential liability of Rs.71,559/-.

.

The Report is made absolute in terms of prayer

clause (a).
